reviews.review_msg: By far the most knowledgeable prof in the Poli Sci department, and wise in a grandfatherly way. He has a wealth of knowledge about a variety of topics and he does not have an overt bias which is refreshing. If you want to understand political theory take his classes, but be prepared to work hard and read a lot. Highly recommended.
Detailed lectures, but unstructured and boring. Difficult marker

Normative theory par excellance. I had the chance to re re read his introduction to a collection of essays pertaining to democratic theory. Miffed was I at the clever boldness which which he pens his thoughts. It is only a matter of time before he publishes a book which is sure surely capture the CB Macpherson award for outstanding theory.
Remi is a kind prof. Always encourages students to speak in class and sincerely wants you to do the best. He is willing to give helpful feedback and is open to communicating.
